TITLE: Creating a Basic Telegram Bot with grammY in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to create a simple Telegram bot using the grammY module. It demonstrates setting up a bot instance, handling different types of messages including commands, text messages, photos, and edited messages, and starting the bot. SOURCE: https://github.com/grammyjs/grammy/blob/main/src/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { Bot } from "https://deno.land/x/grammy/mod.ts"; // Create bot object const bot = new Bot(""); // <-- place your bot token inside this string // Listen for messages bot.command("start", (ctx) => ctx.reply("Welcome! Send me a photo!")); bot.on("message:text", (ctx) => ctx.reply("That is text and not a photo!")); bot.on("message:photo", (ctx) => ctx.reply("Nice photo! Is that you?")); bot.on( "edited_message", (ctx) => ctx.reply("Ha! Gotcha! You just edited this!", { reply_parameters: { message_id: ctx.editedMessage.message_id }, }), ); // Launch! bot.start(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Basic Echo Bot with grammY DESCRIPTION: Example code showing how to create a simple Telegram bot that echoes back received text messages. Demonstrates bot initialization, message handling, and starting the bot with long polling. SOURCE: https://github.com/grammyjs/grammy/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` const { Bot } = require("grammy"); // Create a bot object const bot = new Bot(""); // <-- place your bot token in this string // Register listeners to handle messages bot.on("message:text", (ctx) => ctx.reply("Echo: " + ctx.message.text)); // Start the bot (using long polling) bot.start(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing grammY with NPM DESCRIPTION: Command to install the grammY package using NPM package manager SOURCE: https://github.com/grammyjs/grammy/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install grammy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running a grammY Telegram Bot with Deno DESCRIPTION: This command shows how to run a Telegram bot created with grammY using the Deno runtime. The --allow-net flag grants the necessary network permissions for the bot to communicate with the Telegram API. SOURCE: https://github.com/grammyjs/grammy/blob/main/src/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` deno run --allow-net bot.ts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing grammY from GitHub Source using npm DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to install grammY directly from its GitHub repository using npm. It includes commands for installing from the main branch or a specific branch. SOURCE: https://github.com/grammyjs/grammy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` # main branch npm install github:grammyjs/grammy # another branch, e.g. called branch-name npm install github:grammyjs/grammy#branch-name ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running the Bot DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Telegram bot using Node.js SOURCE: https://github.com/grammyjs/grammy/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` node bot.js ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML Contributors Table with Avatars and Contribution Types DESCRIPTION: A responsive HTML table that displays contributor information including avatar images, usernames, and contribution type icons.
